feed.title: Combined summary - Building BDB on MingW

entry.title: Combined summary - Building BDB on MingW
entry.summary: Amir Taaki contacted Wladimir for assistance in building Berkeley DB (BDB) on MingW. The recipient provided a link to an Oracle forum thread that suggested a solution, but Amir encountered the same issue as described in a Bitcointalk thread. Amir managed to compile it using --disable-thread_api and --disable-replication flags, but when running bitcoind, it threw a DbRunRecoveryException over the DB_RUNRECOVERY flag. Many people do not use MingW to compile bitcoind on Windows due to the lack of pthreads and missing functions such as strncasecmp, _strlwr, _fileno, and swprintf. The email conversation between Amir and Wladimir took place within a larger communication thread, possibly on a technical support forum or messaging platform. Although it is unclear what specific error Amir was referencing, he shared his input commands and error message in the post. The error message indicates that there are two or more data types in declaration specifiers, causing the make command to fail. The proposed fix in the forum thread did not work for him. In such cases, users may benefit from consulting resources like online tutorials, troubleshooting guides, or relevant forums where others may have encountered similar problems. It is essential to seek help when facing technical difficulties and approach problem-solving with patience and persistence. By utilizing available resources and reaching out to others for support, users can resolve issues and improve their overall technology literacy.
